thread.title: Childish Gambino Confirms Working With Chance the Rapper, Says Collaboration Is About 'Catching A Vibe'
thread.title_full: Childish Gambino Confirms Working With Chance the Rapper, Says Collaboration Is About 'Catching A Vibe'

author: Carl Lamarre
title: Childish Gambino Confirms Working With Chance the Rapper, Says Collaboration Is About 'Catching A Vibe'
text:
COMMENTS George Pimentel/WireImage Donald Glover poses in the press room during the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on Jan. 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, Calif. 
Earlier this week, Childish Gambino revived the rumor of him teaming up with Chance the Rapper on a joint project when he checked in with Big Boy's Neighborhood on L.A.'s Real 92.3. 
"We definitely met up," Gambino told the station . "I don't know if I'll see him again now that he's won a Grammy. We'll see what happens. We actually sat down in the studio and were talking for a little bit. I mean, we’re both busy, but when he has like a moment we’ve just been sitting down and just working together. I think it’s about catching a vibe.” 
Gambino also mentioned how he'd prefer to work with Chance in the studio, rather than collaborating over e-mail. “I just wanna hang out with him. I don't work with people over email anymore. I think it just doesn't make for good work. We just have to find a time to sit down together," he said. 
Last January, the two stars snapped a photo together on Chance's Instagram, sparking rumors of a joint project. The caption read "Hawaii then LA, back to work. #roscoeswetsuit." In 2013, Chance made an appearance in Gambino's Because of the Internet screenplay , where the two coined the phrase "Roscoe's sweatsuit." 
On the music front, Chance and Gambino partnered up for two collaborations in the past. First, the latter appeared on "Favorite Song" from Chance's acclaimed mixtape Acid Rap . The Chi-Town rep then returned the favor on Gambino's Because of the Internet album, teaming up for "The Worst Guys." 
Check out the 21-minute interview below, as Gambino also speaks on his new album Awaken, My Love! and his upcoming Star Wars and Spider-Man film roles, and also shares an update on season two of his FX hit series Atlanta . A post shared by Chance The Rapper (@chancetherapper) on Jan 2, 2017 at 4:16pm PST
